gaia::storage::Cursor Class Reference

This class provides random read-write access to the result set returned by a database query. More...

#include <Cursor.h>

Detailed Description

This class provides random read-write access to the result set returned by a database query. 

 // you can not new Cursor instance, because it is created by SQLiteDatabase.
 String* tablename = new String("databae_test");
 Cursor* cursor = database->query(*tablename);

 // Parse data
 cursor->moveToFirst()
 while(cursor->moveToNext)
 {
   // Get data by first column
   cursor->getInt(0);
   // Get data by second column
   curosr->getString(1);
 }
 cursor->close();

Definition at line 47 of file Cursor.h.

virtual core::Persistence gaia::storage::Cursor::getExtras ( ) [pure virtual]

Returns a bundle of extra values.

This is an optional way for cursors to provide out-of-band metadata to their users. One use of this is for reporting on the progress of network requests that are required to fetch data for the cursor.

These values may only change when requery is called.

Returns:
cursor-defined values, or Bundle.EMPTY if there are no values. Never null.

Implemented in gaia::storage::CursorImpl, gaia::storage::CursorWrapper, gaia::storage::MatrixCursor, and gaia::storage::MergeCursor.

virtual int32_t gaia::storage::Cursor::getPosition ( ) [pure virtual]

Returns the current position of the Cursor in the row set.

The value is zero-based. When the row set is first returned the Cursor will be at positon -1, which is before the first row. After the last row is returned another call to next() will leave the Cursor past the last entry, at a position of count().

Returns:
the current Cursor position.

Implemented in gaia::storage::CursorImpl, gaia::storage::CursorWrapper, gaia::storage::MatrixCursor, and gaia::storage::MergeCursor.

virtual bool gaia::storage::Cursor::moveToNext ( ) [pure virtual]

Move the Cursor to the next row.

This method will return false if the Cursor is already past the last entry in the result set.

Returns:
whether the move succeeded.

Implemented in gaia::storage::CursorImpl, gaia::storage::CursorWrapper, gaia::storage::MatrixCursor, and gaia::storage::MergeCursor.

virtual bool gaia::storage::Cursor::moveToPosition ( int32_t  position) [pure virtual]

Move the Cursor to an absolute position.

The valid range of values is -1 <= position <= count. This method will return true if the request destination was reachable, otherwise, it returns false.

Parameters:
positionthe zero-based position to move to
Returns:
whether the requested move fully succeeded.

Implemented in gaia::storage::CursorImpl, gaia::storage::CursorWrapper, gaia::storage::MatrixCursor, and gaia::storage::MergeCursor.

virtual bool gaia::storage::Cursor::moveToPrevious ( ) [pure virtual]

Move the Cursor to the previous row.

This method will return false if the Cursor is already before the first entry in the result set.

Returns:
whether the move succeeded.

Implemented in gaia::storage::CursorImpl, gaia::storage::CursorWrapper, gaia::storage::MatrixCursor, and gaia::storage::MergeCursor.

virtual void gaia::storage::Cursor::registerContentObserver ( const ContentObserver &  observer) [pure virtual]

Register an observer that is called when changes happen to the content backing this Cursor.

Typically the data set won't change until requery() is called.

Parameters:
observerthe object that gets notified when the content backing the Cursor changes.
See also:
unregisterContentObserver(ContentObserver)

Implemented in gaia::storage::CursorImpl, gaia::storage::CursorWrapper, gaia::storage::MatrixCursor, and gaia::storage::MergeCursor.

virtual void gaia::storage::Cursor::registerDataSetObserver ( const DataSetObserver &  observer) [pure virtual]

Register an observer that is called when changes happen to the contents of the this cursors data set, for example, when the data set is changed via requery(), deactivate(), or close().

Parameters:
observerthe object that gets notified when the cursors data set changes.
See also:
unregisterDataSetObserver(DataSetObserver)

Implemented in gaia::storage::CursorImpl, gaia::storage::CursorWrapper, gaia::storage::MatrixCursor, and gaia::storage::MergeCursor.

virtual bool gaia::storage::Cursor::requery ( ) [pure virtual]

Performs the query that created the Cursor again, refreshing its contents.

This may be done at any time, including after a call to deactivate.

Returns:
true if the requery succeeded, false if not, in which case the Cursor becomes invalid.

Implemented in gaia::storage::CursorImpl, gaia::storage::CursorWrapper, gaia::storage::MatrixCursor, and gaia::storage::MergeCursor.

virtual void gaia::storage::Cursor::setNotificationUri ( const gaia::core::ContentResolver &  cr,
const gaia::net::Uri &  uri 
) [pure virtual]

Register to watch a content URI for changes.

Parameters:
crThe content resolver from the caller's context. The listener attached to this resolver will be notified.
uriThe content URI to watch.

Implemented in gaia::storage::CursorImpl, gaia::storage::CursorWrapper, gaia::storage::MatrixCursor, and gaia::storage::MergeCursor.
